name: Arlan
descHash: The head of Herta Space Station's Security Department. This quiet boy hopes to protect the researchers who value their pursuit of knowledge, and to help them to complete their work.

29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

151160.name: Lightning Crown of the Past Shadow
151160.desc: Headwear of the Guardian Shadows. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
151160.lore:
Accessory left behind by the shadow of a past Guardian, telling tales of the city of Everwinter.

"Svetlana the Harsh — her wrath as terrifying as thunder and her retribution as swift as lightning."

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

549438.name: Extinguished Core
549438.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Crude material used for enhancement.
549438.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
A heavy blow has caused this heart to stop beating and lose its luster.

"Preliminary tests indicate it's some kind of hybrid: one half is primordial, and the other half is something very similar to Stellarons." — Department of Biology, Sarah Castro
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Flamespawns or other enemies

633379.name: Glimmering Core
633379.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Normal material used for enhancement.
633379.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is glimmering and the veins on it indicate it's still alive.

"What kind of monster is this? Did you see it... Its face! It has the face of our previous leader!"
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Equilibrium Level 2+ Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Equilibrium Level 2+ Flamespawns or other enemies

635673.name: Shattered Blade
635673.desc: Weapon fragments left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
635673.lore:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon rides on a scarlet horse to ignite cities, to take peace from humankind, and to bring down nations akin to anthills.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with driving peace out of nations."

717320.name: Squirming Core
717320.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717320.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is pulsating slowly, with a residual force powerful enough to cause a new calamity. It's best to destroy it to prevent further troubles.

"It's like a cancer..."
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Equilibrium Level 4+ Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Equilibrium Level 4+ Flamespawns or other enemies

836259.name: Worldbreaker Blade
836259.desc: Broken weapon left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
836259.lore:
This weapon represents its owner's rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The owner of this weapon makes their appearance at the end of a war to fan the embers to consume the world. Regardless of the glories of the past or the blessing of its deities, this planet is destined to return to the ashes it came from, and to wither away in the depths of the starry sky.

The bearer of this brand is tasked with purifying the world.

920200.name: Lifeless Blade
920200.desc: Weapon remnants left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
920200.lore:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon carries a strong hatred for all sentient beings. They relish in the lament of intelligent beings as sweet melodies and topple civilizations with millennia of history in the blink of an eye.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with stopping breath among the living."

985668.name: Destroyer's Final Road
985668.lore:
The Leviathan's heart has stopped beating, but its mind lives on despite being trapped in a case. As long as the lid is closed, its mind is simultaneously both alive and dead, driving the engine of destruction.

"Doomsday Beast, a blight made in the Warforge using what's left of a Leviathan and the weeping bones of thousands of the dead. It longs for the destruction of the universe and itself."

ranks.name: To the Bitter End
ranks.descHash: When HP is lower than or equal to <nobr>50%</nobr> of Max HP, increases Skill's DMG by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

ranks.name: Breaking Free
ranks.descHash: Using Skill or Ultimate removes 1 debuff from oneself.

ranks.name: Power Through
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Turn the Tables
ranks.descHash: When struck by a killing blow after entering battle, instead of becoming knocked down, Arlan immediately restores his HP to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of his Max HP. This effect is automatically removed after it is triggered once or after <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s) have elapsed.

ranks.name: Hammer and Tongs
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Self-Sacrifice
ranks.descHash: When HP drops to <nobr>50%</nobr> or below, Ultimate deals <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> more DMG. The DMG multiplier of DMG taken by the target enemy now applies to adjacent enemies as well.

skills.name: Lightning Rush
skills.descHash: Deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Arlan's ATK to a single enemy.

skills.name: Shackle Breaker
skills.descHash: Consumes Arlan's HP equal to #1[i]% of his Max HP to deal Lightning DMG equal to #2[i]% of Arlan's ATK to a single enemy. If Arlan does not have sufficient HP, his HP will be reduced to 1 after using his Skill.

skills.name: Frenzied Punishment
skills.descHash: Deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Arlan's ATK to a single enemy and Lightning DMG equal to #2[i]% of Arlan's ATK to enemies adjacent to it.

skills.name: Pain and Anger
skills.descHash: Increases Arlan's DMG for every percent of HP below his Max HP, up to a max of #1[i]% more DMG.

skills.name: Attack
skills.descHash: Attack an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduce their Toughness of the corresponding Type.

skills.name: Swift Harvest
skills.descHash: Immediately attacks the enemy. After entering battle, deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Arlan's ATK to all enemies.

embedBonusSkill.name: Revival
embedBonusSkill.descHash: If the current HP percentage is <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> or lower when defeating an enemy, immediately restores HP equal to <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of Max HP.

embedBonusSkill.name: Repel
embedBonusSkill.descHash: Upon entering battle, if Arlan's HP is less than or equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>, he can nullify all DMG received except for DoT until after he is attacked.

embedBonusSkill.name: Endurance
embedBonusSkill.descHash: The chance to resist DoT Debuffs increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Hello, Trailblazer. I'm Arlan, I head up the Security Department on Herta Space Station. I'll be in charge of your safety during your time here.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: Seed Isle's latest flavors of dried earthworm hit the shelves today — we should head over before the queue starts. The early bird catches the... anyway.

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: You should have some mixed vegetable juice before bed — it helps you sleep. Well, I'm on night duty tonight. See you tomorrow.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Looking for Peppy
voiceItems.text: We've held the Space Station Peppy-Finding Contest nine times so far, and I've... I've won it nine times in a row.

voiceItems.title: Chat: On Patrol
voiceItems.text: I try to be inconspicuous when I'm on patrol. That way, I can avoid disturbing the researchers while they work and observe their utmost concentration.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: You should keep your sword sharp at all times.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: Oh, man! The phone case shipping location is too far from the space station — you have to buy <nobr>5000</nobr> units for them to deliver... Wait, please don't tell Lady Asta that.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: There are some sword fragments housed here on the space station, but I can't find them in the pictographic index... They must be pretty special.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: I heard the researchers say that there are some curios that actively requested to come to the space station.

voiceItems.title: About Asta
voiceItems.text: *sigh* ...I don't know why, but it seems like I manage to annoy Lady Asta fairly regularly.

voiceItems.title: About Herta
voiceItems.text: I'm different from the researchers — I'm not what you'd call a "follower" of Madam Herta — but she still lets me work here.

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
The inarticulate head of the Herta space station's Security Department.
While scientific research is beyond his understanding, Arlan is willing to risk his life to protect the staff who value research so very much. He is used to pain and wears his scars like badges of honor.
Only when holding Peppy does the boy let down his guard and show a rare smile.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
How is Arlan's work in the Security Department?
— Brother Arlan is the beacon that guides the Security Department, the core support for everyone's battles! Without him, the space station would fall to pieces in a day. Without him, people's lives would be ruined in ten days. Without him, the station would be hellish in just one hundred days!
— But he plays holodisc with Peppy during work hours.
— Because he's finished all daily security tasks ahead of schedule! His mere presence is an inspiration to us all.
— But he plays holodisc with Peppy during work hours.
— How do you know that playing holodisc with Peppy isn't actually part of his job description...

"You're not allowed to play with your phone while out on patrol. Give it to me."
"No, brother Arlan! People are talking smack about you in the group chat! Don't you care?"
"Nope. Too busy."
"Huh, have you got an urgent mission? Let me go with you. What happened?"
"I'm taking Peppy to do rehab through play holodisc."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
There are countless strange and valuable things around Miss Asta's house, but it's the dog at death's door that attracts the most attention.

What's more, her forlorn cries only increase in volume as her parents attempt to comfort her — telling her that this dog she picked up won't live for very long, and they are better off buying her another one.

That filthy pup just lies there without the strength to even lift up its head and look around the people surround it. The crying, arguing, and the silence... None of this has anything to do with it.

At one point, he thinks it had already stopped breathing, so he bends down to check its nose. Just then, the dog suddenly licks his fingers — which is about the farthest distance it can stretch.

— Its tongue is wet.

"Wanna play holodisc?"

Its lifeless eyes suddenly light up.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
He stops pacing in the corridor and gazes out of the window into the tranquility of deep space, the dark circles around his eyes reflecting back at him.

Another pair of bloodshot eyes appears at the window. Their owner looks more relaxed than she usually does before the researchers, and absentmindedly lets out a huge yawn.

"You're up late. Not going to bed?"
"I'm feeling anxious, so I'm just out for a patrol..."
"I just updated the firmware for the defense shield, and security systems are all operating smoothly."
"Maybe I'm overthinking things, but..."
"I understand. You're the head of security, and I trust your instincts."

The space station remains brightly lit and operates without a stop. They each return to their respective posts.

They both know that regardless of the protection of Madam Herta's fame, the defensive measures around the space station, and the round-the-clock vigilance of the Security Department — if a disaster was to occur...

It would only take seconds.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"Everyone's evacuated. Arlan. Hurry up!"
"There may still be survivors inside."
"No... There aren't any more life signs in there."

He thought he could trust Asta until the moment when countless Antimatter Legion pawns pour towards him like a tsunami. The signal from the watcher zone is faint. Asta won't be able to see this situation.

He is now standing, alone, in the elevator. He has to make a decision, even if he has to disobey Asta's orders — No matter the cost, he has to block access to the elevator to save everyone. He cannot allow these monsters to get to the master control zone.

"Sorry, Miss Asta..."

The Antimatter Legion strikes him down from behind before he can explain himself. He falls, and his remote communications disconnects.

He had never hesitated, whether working in Miss Asta's home or after becoming Herta Space Station's head of Security Department. He had always taken for granted that, since Miss Asta decided to head in one direction, he has to follow her.

Arlan raises his head with great difficulty, and the monsters move closer to him. He had never disobeyed an order from Miss Asta before. This is the first time.

"Hopefully it won't be the last time."

This thought pops up in his head.

Propping himself up with his greatsword, he slowly and firmly stands up.
